wikipedia_page.main: George Walker (December 24, 1772 – February 8, 1847) was an English gothic novelist and publisher.  He was born in Falcon Square, Cripplegate, London, England.  He worked as a bookseller and music publisher, into which business his son George (1803–1879) also entered. His writings were anti-reform, reacting to writers such as William Godwin and Thomas Holcroft.
